channel.title: Able to do this with Rscd?
channel.description:
Host my site for registrations on something like, hostgator lets say. Host my Database on a separate dedicated server.(Just by itself) Host my ls server on a separate dedicated server Then host my run-server on a separate Dedicated server?
I'm pretty sure you're able to, just wondering if anyone has done it & if it actually works? Or tried.

item.title: Able to do this with Rscd?
item.dc:creator: @IlikeArrays IlikeArrays
item.description:
@IlikeArrays wrote:

mapu:

The answer is yes. We do it for last stand.

Well not exactly what he is mentioning but yes the DB is on different server.

Read full topic
item.source: Able to do this with Rscd?

item.source: Able to do this with Rscd?

item.title: Able to do this with Rscd?
item.dc:creator: @hm_wtf_lol_xD hm wtf lol xD
item.description:
@hm_wtf_lol_xD wrote:

[quote=“uberpk3r, post:13, topic:376034”][quote author=Anc13nts253 link=topic=471967.msg3452579#msg3452579 date=1293854671]

Retarded idea, just like the person who posted this… Wow congrats you are going to use 2-3 different servers for stupid stupid things… You need to wake up and notice how stupid this idea is congrats if a private server can cover the cost of you maintaining the servers and etc… I would like you to research about this more… If you get a good dedicated server let’s say it has 16gb of ram or something cache 4gb to the sql 6 to the webserver and 6 to the server… That will be far enough to run a private server at a good speed… The thing what pisses me off people think running private servers on a good dedicated server is all what needs to be done? You need to cache more memory to it than the default what people have setup on there home computer (512-1046)mb of ram… Yours need to think to be honest
[/quote] I don’t have a 16GB Dedi, ect. I only have a few with 6b & a few 4gb.

Here’s some specs:

Dedi #1 Specs:

Windows Server 2008 (Standard) 45 GB C: 90 GB D: Quad Core AMD Opteron Processor 2374 HE 2.20 GHZ Memory\Ram: 4GB 64-bit OS

Dedi #2 Specs:

930 GB c: (Almost 1 Tera!) Intel(R) Core(TM) i7 CPU 870 @ 2.93 GHz Memory\Ram: 6gb 64-bit OS

Dedi #3

230 GB C: 220 GB E: Microsoft Windows server 2003 Enterprise Edition Intel Core DUO CPU e7500 @ 2.93 GHz Memory\Ram: 4gb

Dedi #4

465 GB c: Intel Core Quad CPU Q6600 @ 2.40 GHz 32-bit OS Memory/Ram: 2GB

Dedi #5

29 GB C: 203 GB D: 465 GB F: Intel Xeon CPU E3110 @ 3.00 GHz Memory/Ram: 4GB Microsoft Windows 2003 R2 Enterprise edition (Service pack 1)

Those are the only good ones I have. The others are around 2gb:\1gb

& I was just thinking it would be able to run faster\smoother if I used separate one’s instead of a single one.

Be aware its not safe to start hosting off someone elses dedi, if they regover or notice you they will shut down.[/quote] Captain Obvious!! Never liked the guy who shows off with the dedicated servers they have, All I gave them was a sample of what can be done to give better performance of the webserver sql and server… But he went on… I ant got a 16gb one though marky moo

Kids.

Read full topic
item.source: Able to do this with Rscd?

item.title: Able to do this with Rscd?
item.dc:creator: @uberpk3r uberpk3r
item.description:
@uberpk3r wrote:

[quote=“Anc13nts253, post:10, topic:376034”][quote author=hm wtf lol xD link=topic=471967.msg3452010#msg3452010 date=1293815040]
Retarded idea, just like the person who posted this… Wow congrats you are going to use 2-3 different servers for stupid stupid things… You need to wake up and notice how stupid this idea is congrats if a private server can cover the cost of you maintaining the servers and etc… I would like you to research about this more… If you get a good dedicated server let’s say it has 16gb of ram or something cache 4gb to the sql 6 to the webserver and 6 to the server… That will be far enough to run a private server at a good speed… The thing what pisses me off people think running private servers on a good dedicated server is all what needs to be done? You need to cache more memory to it than the default what people have setup on there home computer (512-1046)mb of ram… Yours need to think to be honest
[/quote] I don’t have a 16GB Dedi, ect. I only have a few with 6b & a few 4gb.

Here’s some specs:

Dedi #1 Specs:

Windows Server 2008 (Standard) 45 GB C: 90 GB D: Quad Core AMD Opteron Processor 2374 HE 2.20 GHZ Memory\Ram: 4GB 64-bit OS

Dedi #2 Specs:

930 GB c: (Almost 1 Tera!) Intel(R) Core(TM) i7 CPU 870 @ 2.93 GHz Memory\Ram: 6gb 64-bit OS

Dedi #3

230 GB C: 220 GB E: Microsoft Windows server 2003 Enterprise Edition Intel Core DUO CPU e7500 @ 2.93 GHz Memory\Ram: 4gb

Dedi #4

465 GB c: Intel Core Quad CPU Q6600 @ 2.40 GHz 32-bit OS Memory/Ram: 2GB

Dedi #5

29 GB C: 203 GB D: 465 GB F: Intel Xeon CPU E3110 @ 3.00 GHz Memory/Ram: 4GB Microsoft Windows 2003 R2 Enterprise edition (Service pack 1)

Those are the only good ones I have. The others are around 2gb:\1gb

& I was just thinking it would be able to run faster\smoother if I used separate one’s instead of a single one.[/quote]

Be aware its not safe to start hosting off someone elses dedi, if they regover or notice you they will shut down.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Intoxication Intoxication
item.description:
@Intoxication wrote:

[quote=“Anc13nts253, post:10, topic:376034”][quote author=hm wtf lol xD link=topic=471967.msg3452010#msg3452010 date=1293815040]
Retarded idea, just like the person who posted this… Wow congrats you are going to use 2-3 different servers for stupid stupid things… You need to wake up and notice how stupid this idea is congrats if a private server can cover the cost of you maintaining the servers and etc… I would like you to research about this more… If you get a good dedicated server let’s say it has 16gb of ram or something cache 4gb to the sql 6 to the webserver and 6 to the server… That will be far enough to run a private server at a good speed… The thing what pisses me off people think running private servers on a good dedicated server is all what needs to be done? You need to cache more memory to it than the default what people have setup on there home computer (512-1046)mb of ram… Yours need to think to be honest
[/quote] I don’t have a 16GB Dedi, ect. I only have a few with 6b & a few 4gb.

Here’s some specs:

Dedi #1 Specs:

Windows Server 2008 (Standard) 45 GB C: 90 GB D: Quad Core AMD Opteron Processor 2374 HE 2.20 GHZ Memory\Ram: 4GB 64-bit OS

Dedi #2 Specs:

930 GB c: (Almost 1 Tera!) Intel(R) Core(TM) i7 CPU 870 @ 2.93 GHz Memory\Ram: 6gb 64-bit OS

Dedi #3

230 GB C: 220 GB E: Microsoft Windows server 2003 Enterprise Edition Intel Core DUO CPU e7500 @ 2.93 GHz Memory\Ram: 4gb

Dedi #4

465 GB c: Intel Core Quad CPU Q6600 @ 2.40 GHz 32-bit OS Memory/Ram: 2GB

Dedi #5

29 GB C: 203 GB D: 465 GB F: Intel Xeon CPU E3110 @ 3.00 GHz Memory/Ram: 4GB Microsoft Windows 2003 R2 Enterprise edition (Service pack 1)

Those are the only good ones I have. The others are around 2gb:\1gb

& I was just thinking it would be able to run faster\smoother if I used separate one’s instead of a single one.[/quote]

For one, you need to get off windows regardless of how you host your server. Pick a Linux distro and install X, it’s barely any different.

Read full topic
